column5: If we get back to talking hockey on this one , i have a picture of me and you taken in the mid fiftys that i'll post up .
gotta love it when comedic art imitates life....or is it vice versa

Kingston at White's. A friend of mine went there regularly and chatted with Baun when things weren't too busy. He forewarned me that, if I went there, not to ask about that famous goal. Apparently he was tired of being asked about that.
Moncton for Tim's per Capita  But Cambridge has about 25 of them
Ottawa St.... Been there before I was born!... they have a large bronze plaque on the wall outside of this location...  Moncton.... insane, last I checked they had 20...  G.

I think North Bay has 12 or 13 of them and one just closed in our Canadian Tire store (because the store wouldn't give them more space to expand). Not sure how big Moncton is but North Bay is only 54,000.
Midland is only 16,000 at best + 8000 for Penetang... 6 locations.
One just opened in Red Lake a couple of months ago. They'll probably make more money than Goldcorp.
Probably Dan.. I know the "temporary" store on King Street in Midland CLEARS a million a year... just because people can't brew their own....
Most Tims per , i'd say London Ont .
per capita it used to be brantford...but im not sure now  up where i live we have 4 for 12000 people...

I remember when St.Catharines was mentioned on the Tonight Show having the most donut shops per capita anywhere in North America..  That's when donuts were good!  Anyone remember Homestead Donuts?  Oh man, to die for!
The best donuts i ever , well there were many but that little bakery that used to be beside the train tracks in Baden Ont ...awsome.

OK, we have a 2 time winner!!.  So many got the right answer---I guess the question was a bit too easy. Here's a double-barreled question for the 'grand prize' of 12 of the same liquid: Which former teammate of Tim's owned an operated a Timmys in the GTA and where was it loated?
Bancroft as 3, 2 full stores and 1 gas station one, population 3,000 give or take.
Bobby Baun and I'd say the store was in Scarberia.. but I couldn't tell you where exactly.
make that a 3 time winner
Nope, sorry. Close only counts in horseshoes and hand grenades, as they say.(Gotta at least get the town or city right)
LOL.. I figured Kingston Road had to be in Scarberia.. but I guess it was actually Pickering.
Been drinking more McDonald's coffee lately.  Rarely a line-up, same price, tastes every bit as good.

Not here.....McDonald's has been selling their coffee for $.79 per ANY SIZE cup since the first of the year here....and I do agree, less of a line....when I drive on Tuesday's that definitely one of my stops now on my route....It's good coffee, just not as strong as Timmy's...I like stronger coffee....that's why I put Starbuck's as # 1 in my book. Dunkin Donuts is too weak for me so I never go there.
Thanks for sharing
It actually just happened to me  Me - "I'll have a large double double"  Her - "An XL double double?"  Me - "No a L double double"  Her - "So a M double double then"  Me - "Press L on you register"
it dose'nt take much some time to slow them up hum ......
And to think....their probably college grads working there....
Glad she doesn't work at Victoria Secret !
Seems a lot easier getting a cup of coffee here in the USA....

Aren't they just switching back to the sizes they used to sell.?  I always remember back in the day, they had way bigger cups. Then they downsized, with out a big dog and pony show.  Now they're just bumping it back up to what it was before...???
Eric Nesterenko, Pit Martin, Chico Maki, Doug Mohnes, Bill White, Keith Magnusun (RIP), Jim Pappin... Gotta be one of these dudes.
keep tryin  edit: one of the TP alumni and played his final season as a Leaf
What year ?
NHL career from 1955 to 69, yeah I'm old
He now lives just north of Barrie, lol.
Iwas gona say he wore yellow but now i am not sure , was it Ken D
Pierre Pilote

Tim Horton was playing for the Buffalo Sabres at the time of his death....instead of taking the team bus to Toronto he drove his Pantera sports car to the game in Toronto because he had family and friends he wanted to spend time with after the game...Punch Imlach the first GM of the Sabres allow Tim to do this....he partied with friends and family after the game and had a horrible accident where authorities figured he was going in excess of 100 miles per hour when he missed a curve and hit a concrete culvert and throw from the vehicle because he was not wearing a seat belt. He died the way he played the game.....  Rest in Peace Tim
Not Chico Maki, he lives next door to my dad
the spelling wont be right but i think i can thro out a few old names , Ken Dryden , Dave Keyon , Darly Sitler , Eddy Shack ........................
A list like that and no Stan Makita, Bobby or Dennis?
ding ding ding we have a winner
Awsome , Pierre Pilote has to live close to the winner ............lol
OK, for a free 6 pack of Coors Lite( I drink a vaguely similar product called beer  but don't know what to do with this stuff) name 1 other NHLer who owned a donut shop(maybe several).
Stan Mikita in Waynes World
Pat LaFontaine
Eddie Shack put his name on a small chain of donut stores.  Now whether he actually owned any of them.. he probably doesn't even remember!

Yep... Pantera ...  70's Supercar ...330hp 351 Ford ... 160mph..  My brother has an autographed Victoriaville stick signed by Tim himself .... And on a side note .. I like the new cup size ... I now have one XL instead of 2 x L ( last weeks XL) it's saving me about 14$ a week.  ♪♫ Tim Horton's cup I fill you up, Let's have a Coffee!! let's have a Coffee!!, I love you Tim Horton's cup, I lift you up proceed to Drive Thru proceed to Drive Thru ♪♫  Randy.

I go to Timmies today and place my order to the lady. I asked for a large double double. She says "are you aweare of our new sizes?" I said yes I am. She then says "so you would still like a large double double?" I said yes please.     So I pull up to the window and she hands me this....    They have known about this for months and still use XL lids? That is where it is going to be confusing for customers.
Eddie Shack Wayne, there still is a shop in Caledon on Hwy 10 that has his name on it!
ohhhhhhh its on the tip of my tounge.....i know it was in St. Thomas ontario....but i cant THINK....   i wasnt thinking of Eddie Shack
Dunkin Donuts after Keith Duncan...........or Robin's Donuts after Robyn Regehr?

Indeed... and it is STILL there!  Now... can anyone tell me where the first Tim Hortons opened? Specifically what street etc... and no cheating using google... there is a huge plaque on this location...  Also what other city has more Tim's then any other per capita....
Hamilton.. but I'd have to guess on the street.. Main?  ..and more Tim's per capita.. I think that's Midland with 6 of the stupid things!
Skippy, actually they did this not too long ago on one of our local TV news channels.....the younguns didn't have a clue....
Lets every one let them try to answer it , Twocoda am sorry i realized after i did it that i may have hyjacked your thread .....Sorry .

no worries Skip....a thread is a thread no matter where it goes...as long as ya have some fun along the way ....post away ....doesnt hurt my feelings at all...(the thread was started to put a smile on someones face)

I make way better coffee at home in my black and decker kitchen professional coffee maker than Tim's and with McD's is too close to call to be honest. So when I go fishing I buy an McD XL for whoever is along, with a muffin to have a quick breakfast as we race to the spot. Which btw is still cheaper per person than a large at Timmies.  That said after work today I realized I had not had my usual 3 cups of java so I broke down and bought the new XL at Timmies. Same sub par coffee just more of it LOL. Since they changed roasters from Mother Parkers to do it themselves, they have been living off their name and the habits of people who have trained their cars to go through that drive thru. (just to give you an idea what I mean I used to deliver to a coffee franchise that had a drive thru on my bread route, I got hit 4 times in that parking lot carrying in the order ALL by people who nodded for me to go ahead then they would look down for change or zone out and bump me with the car as I was walking by. Anyone who doesn't believe zombies exist never took the walk of death through that parking lot LOL)  As for who can drink 24ozs of coffee, I swithced from a 12 cup brewer to an 8 cup at home to cut down on my consumption on the days I don't work in the morning.... So one XL is nothing LOL.
now thats funny
Hockey player?
Tim Horton died in my home town.
Studebaker dealership owner
Good answer, young whiper snapper. You can go back to playing with your new-fangled whats-its.
No Clue what Tim Hortons did for a living, but Tim Horton played hockey and was involved with the chain.   Here's another one: The first Tim Hortons were not doughnut shops. They were???
Hamburger shops
From my hometown. Of course I'm not old enough to have been there first hand, I had to learn that by reading books.

Tim Horton played in the NHL  for the Toronto Maple leafs , he died on the Gardiner Express way doing over a 120 miles an hour , "not 120k's" when his Trimuph Spitfire convertable fliped over , in the mid 70's , he was critizied for taking his hockey playing money and thinking he could open  coffee selling stores and making any money at it .An one who wants to add to this or correct it to be more spaciffic go ahead thats a way back for me to remember every detail .
A Pantara but you're pretty good on the rest Skip!
He wasn't playin' for the Leafs at time.
He died in St.Catharines right in front of my best friends fathers glass shop...  Just past 12 Mile creek on the QEW (Almost right under the Ontario street bridge)
Buffalo
Wasn't the Gardiner Expressway either
Here's some hockey/donut shop trivia for ya's. Anybody ever heard of Stan Makita doughnuts??
What former Chicago Blackhawk Captain had a string of laundromats in Bill M's hometown ?

I can't remeMber that one KF . but at one time i knew the excact spot on the hi way where the accident toke play from driving by it every day in my 1962 chevy impala . Dam i am getting old , think i'll stay quiet from now on ........lol.
The tee pees were the jr club for the hawks, most of the stars from the 50s-60s played there.
LOL.... dont matter,  his coffee cups just got bigger , i wonder how long we'll remember  that into the future.....lol

When it comes to talking about hockey you loose me , i gave up watching hockey when my favorite goal tender Gump Worsly retired , never watched hockey since .When i was a kid i had all the NHL teams hockey cards , the kind where they wereall stuck together and open up like an accordian , if i only still had them today ..lol
Yup, one of my dad's neighbours was none other then the person Dave is talking about above.   I won't give away the answer!  lol!
Nothing like keeping it simple  http://www.facebook.com/#!/photo.php?v=10151184941580321&set=vb.29313088338&type=2&theater
Since Timmies can make the cup sizes bigger, can they do  the same for my wife?
dont know ...ill have to see what they would be working with ...
Good one      :clapping:

I see Timmy's up there is catching up to the USA Timmy's...  Last summer I got a Med on the way home from Cliffs and they gave me that little cup....since I was in a hurry to get on the  road I just thought they made a mistake and screwed me on the price....What was the old small....coffee in a shot glass...
I JUST HAD AN EXTRA-LARGE DOUBLE DOUBLE AND NOW I CAN'T STOP YELLING!
LOL...24 ounces, man, that's alot of pee breaks fishing in the morning

its horse crap...  they have been advertising bigger cup sizes but no increase in price...  2 "old" large coffees is the same price as 2 "new" medium coffees... 2 "new" large coffees is more $$$ then 2 "old" large coffees  all they did was introduce that 24oz monstrosity...  I'm bitter LOL

I just had my first coffee in 9 months and mmm it was good. I did notice that there sizes were all different a medium now is the same price and size as the old large. They are just trying to keep up with Mcdonalds lol.
I was an avid tim hortons guy, but since I got a tasimo, I can't drink that watered down Tim's coffee.
I'd rather go to McD's or CountryStyle.
Still don't know who can drink 24oz's of coffee..especially before it gets cold and nasty
It's the best of both worlds option...coffee for the first half, then "ice coffee".  It truly is an absolutely silly size to sell in a cup.

You just know they are scamming us some how! The US Tim's Extra Large looks bigger, but when I checked and did a comparison in the Spring, theirs is a smaller diameter and slightly taller. Ours still held more coffee! The video by the OP is hilarious!
I guess it's time to bring a thermos, that's enough coffee for the whole day

Twiggs in North Bay offers WAY better coffee, slightly cheaper, don't pay a CEO x-large coffee cups worth of money and their food isn't made to meet minimum food quality standards. I'll be happy if I ever make money shorting Tim Hortons stock.  Can u tell I have a hate-on for Tims? Haha
They are just trying to keep up with McDonalds becasue people are discovering that McDonalds coffee is far better for a cheaper price.
Don't do that! Because the Tim Hortens Cups trails lead you to the secret fishing spots.
Don't do that! Because the Tim Hortens Cups trails lead you to the secret fishing spots.
THAT'S why we are getting fatter as a country!! Just trying to catch up to the Americans I suppose.....

I prefer Timmy's because it's a stronger cup of coffee but McDonalds is OK...and right now ANY size at Mc D's is $.79 per cup....can't beat that with a Ugly Stick....however Starbuck's has them all beat...
Health Canada wants to put a stop to the new cup size.

I'm sure it's a lot cheaper for Tim Hortons to run a single size in the US and Canada.  They've had these monster cups in NY for as long as I can remember.  Anytime Mike and I would go fish some NY tribs, I'd always forget, order a XL and shake my head when it's handed to me through the window, lol.

Heres  DIFFERENT TWIST TO THIS THREAD , i asked a young person not all that long ag if they could tell me if they knew what Tim Hortons did for a living , they could'nt answer the question , any body here under thirty years of age want to take a stab at it , i am sure others will be surprized to find out .
I KNOW  I KNOW  I KNOW but I'm a bit over 30 years old....
